title: Vikings' Katheryn Winnick is getting fans hyped for season 6
text:
Vikings star Katheryn Winnick is getting fans hyped for season 6 (Picture: FilmMagic)

Vikings star Katheryn Winnick is just as excited as we are about the upcoming series of the History Channel hit.

Just last week, fans were treated to the official trailer for the sixth and final season.

And if that wasn’t enough to hype them all up, the Lagertha actress thought she would give the teaser an extra push on Instagram.

Taking to the social media platform, the star shared a snap of herself in character stood next to Bjorn Ironside (played by Alexander Ludwig).

In the caption, she told her 3.4million followers: ‘Smiling because @historyvikings returns for its final season on Dec 4.

‘Be sure to check out the trailer for the epic new season on their Facebook page. #vikings.’

It looks like it’s going to be a ride (Picture: History)

Fans flooded to the comment section and couldn’t help but tell their queen just how much they were looking forward to the show.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Cannot wait to see you slay yet another season,’ one wrote alongside a string of crown emojis, while another added: ‘Last season? I’m gonna cry’.

Someone else said: ‘I cannot wait to see you again my queen, I miss u so much,’ and to be honest – same!

While not much is known about Lagertha’s storyline, the actress has hinted at one last battle for the much-loved shieldmaiden.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

She recently teased Lagertha’s final chapter (Picture: Backgrid)

Chatting to ET Canada the 41-year-old joked that her character is now a granny, as she revealed: ‘It’s going to be adventurous, it’s going to be amazing.

‘I’ll tell you one thing though, she is definitely not done fighting yet. There is still one big battle left to come.’

She went onto say how the upcoming episodes are Lag’s final chapter – and we can’t help but feel that she might die.

‘I feel as though it’s a new chapter of her life, she is trying to now redefine who she is as someone who is a grandmother and used to be a queen, and a warrior, and now finding new peace,’ the star explained.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘And redefining her last chapter.’

Vikings will return to the History Channel and Amazon Prime on 4 December this year.

description: Vikings star Katheryn Winnick is getting fans hyped for season 6 after new trailer drops.
